Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a fish and name it.
The student can draw the water where the fish lives.
The student can draw and label two things the fish needs to survive (like water and plants).
The student can draw another plant or animal that lives in the same water environment as the fish.
The student can show how the fish and the other plant or animal in the drawing use resources from the water (like fish swimming or plants getting sunlight).
The student can show in the drawing how the place and resources meet the needs of both the fish and the other living things in this environment.
